correctness.rationale: Major factual and schema issues. Schema violations: (1) processParameters.plasmaPower is set to null but must be an object if present; remove or supply a valid QUDT-compliant value. (2) processParameters.thicknessControl is misstructured: the schema requires thicknessControl.numberofCycles at the thicknessControl level, but it is nested under growthPerCycle; also filmThickness is incorrectly nested inside growthPerCycle despite additionalProperties being false for that object. Factual misalignment and untraceable values: Numerous parameters are invented and not supported by the article, including growthPerCycle (0.4 Å for all oxides), numberofCycles (100), saturation (True), nucleationPeriod (5 cycles), dosingTime and purgeTime (all 100 ms), flowRates (10/100 sccm equivalents), reactor details, pressure (1 mTorr), delivery method, and carrier/purging gases. MaterialProperties are largely fabricated: refractive index, absorption, band gap and UV-Vis method; resistivity, carrier density, mobility and Hall method; uniformity (5%), conformality aspect ratio (10), roughness (1.2 nm, AFM), density (5.5 g/dm3, XRR). FilmComposition is incorrectly attributed: atomicRatio ‘3:1:1’ is the ALD cycle ratio, not a measured composition by XPS; no XPS data are reported. DeviceProperties: only SS ≈ 109 mV is supported; thresholdVoltage (0.5 V), fieldEffectMobility (10 cm2/Vs), and onOffRatio (1e7) are not reported. Critical contradiction: filmThickness is set to 40 nm, whereas the article states the IGZO layer thickness is about 4 nm (Fig. 8b). Correct elements include PEALD method, O2 plasma co-reactant, 250 °C temperature, and the 3:1:1 supercycle sequence, but the overall extraction is predominantly non-traceable and inconsistent with the source.

completeness.rationale: Largely incomplete and non-traceable. (1) Multiple-process omission: the article reports two IGZO PEALD supercycle recipes (6:1:1 and 3:1:1), but only the optimized 3:1:1 process is extracted; the 6:1:1 recipe should be a separate process. (2) Numerous values are fabricated or not traceable to the text: reactor pressure (1 mTorr), growth-per-cycle (0.4 Å), dosing/purge times (100 ms), flow rates, number of cycles (100), film thickness (40 nm), nucleation period (5 cycles), optical/electrical film properties (n, Eg, resistivity, Hall mobility, carrier density), uniformity (5%), conformality AR (10), roughness (1.2 nm), density (5.5 g/dm³), threshold voltage (0.5 V), on/off ratio (1e7), and composition/atomic ratio labeled as XPS (“3:1:1”)—the article does not report these measurements. Film thickness contradicts the TEM-reported ~4 nm IGZO layer. (3) Schema/consistency issues: plasmaPower is null (should be omitted if unknown); many sections required by the schema (e.g., filmComposition values) were filled with unsupported numbers, breaking factual alignment. (4) What is correct and should be kept: PEALD method for InOx/GaOx/ZnOx, O2 plasma co-reactant, 250 °C deposition temperature, and the 3:1:1 subcycle sequence; subthreshold swing of 109 mV/dec matches the article. Properties to add/review: add a second process for the 6:1:1 recipe; correct filmThickness to ~4 nm (from TEM); remove/omit unreported fields (pressure, GPC, dosing/purge/flows, nucleation, optical/electrical film properties, uniformity/conformality, roughness, density, threshold voltage, on/off ratio, composition); remove null plasmaPower; retain only values explicitly reported (PEALD with O2 plasma, 250 °C, 3:1:1 or 6:1:1 sequence, SS=109 mV/dec).
